name: LinkedIn Conversions API modules
title: LinkedIn Conversions API modules

children.text: After connecting to the LinkedIn Conversions API app, you can use the following modules to build your
Associate Multiple Campaigns to Conversion Rule
Associates multiple campaigns to a conversion rule by their IDs.

data.label: LinkedIn Conversions API
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your LinkedIn Conversions API account

children.text: Add one or more campaigns which you want to associate with the conversion.
Select or map the Conversion Rule ID to which you want to associate the campaign.
Creates a new conversion rule to track conversions.

data.label: LinkedIn Conversions API
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your LinkedIn Conversions API account

children.text: Select or map the account for which you want to create the conversion rule.
Enter (map) a name for the conversion rule.
Select or map the conversion rule type to track this conversion rule. For example,
Select or map the attribution type that describes the process to count the conversion actions:
Specifies a user's settings on the post-click attribution window in days: from 5 to 90 days. The supported values are
Specifies a user's settings on the view through (post view) attribution window in days: from 5 to 90 days. The supported values are
Sends multiple conversion events in a batch.

data.label: LinkedIn Conversions API
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your LinkedIn Conversions API account

children.text: Select or map the account to which you want to send the conversion events.
Enter (map) a name for the conversion rule.
Enter (map) the time at which the conversion happened. You can use the use the
Enter (map) the user's email address. The supported user ID types are Email, LI First Party Ads, Tracking UUID,  Acxiom ID, and Oracle Moat ID
Enter (map) the user's first name. The maximum number of allowed characters is 35.
Enter (map) the user's last name. The maximum number of allowed characters is 35.
Enter (map) the user's company name. The maximum number of allowed characters is 50.
Enter (map) the user's job title. The maximum number of allowed characters is 50.
Enter (map) the user's ISO standardized country code. For example, US.
Enter (map) the lead gen form response of the user. The value should be in the following format:
Select or map the conversion type. For example,
Enter the amount and teh applicable three-letter currency code.
The unique id generated by advertisers to indicate each event. This field is optional and is used for

data.label: LinkedIn Conversions API
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your LinkedIn Conversions API account

children.text: Select or map the accounts for which you want to generate the conversion report.
Select or map the time for which you want to generate the report:
Enter (map) the date to generate the report of the conversions that occurred on or after the specified date.
Enter (map) the date to generate the report of the conversions that occurred on or before the specified date.
Select or map the pivots to include in the report. Conversion is the default pivot and you can add at the most two additional pivots to include in the report.
Select or map the campaigns for which you want to generate the conversion report.
Select or map the fields to include in the report:
Viral External Website Post Click Conversion
Viral External Website Post View Conversion
Select or map the campaign type for which you want to generate the report:
Set the maximum number of results
should return during one execution cycle.
Retrieves a list of conversion rules by the ad account.

data.label: LinkedIn Conversions API
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your LinkedIn Conversions API account

children.text: Select or map the account whose conversion rules you want to list.
Select the filtering method of conversion rules:
Set the maximum number of conversion rules
should return during one execution cycle.

customCSS:
<style>
@media print {
  html, body {
    overflow-x: visible;
  }
}
#tally-widget-button {
  position: fixed !important;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  display: none;
  visibility: visible !important;
  opacity: 1 !important;
  color: #0C121D;
  border: 2px solid #0C121D;
  border-radius: 4px;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  font-size: 14px;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-family: 'Inter';
  text-align: center;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
  cursor: pointer;
  z-index: 999999 !important;
  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
  outline: none;
  touch-action: manipulation;
  pointer-events: auto;
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}
.button-text {
  display: inline-block;
  margin-right: 8px;
}
.button-text::before {
  content: attr(data-text);
}
#tally-widget-popup {
  position: fixed;
  background-color: white;
  display: none;
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
  z-index: 999999;
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 0px solid #0C121D;
  padding-top: 30px;
}
#tally-widget-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;
  right: 10px;
  background: none;
  border: none;
  font-size: 36px;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
  color: #0C121D;
}

  .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
    font-family: 'Inter' !important;
  }

  .dark .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #F6F6F6 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column > div > div > div.flex.flex-1.w-full.justify-center.pb-0 > div > div.flex.items-center.pl-0.pr-2.mb-5.xl\:-mt-1\.5 > div > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > div.flex.pr-2.text-gray-500.items-center {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  a.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-public-space-links-wrap .ab-public-space-link:first-of-type {
    border-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-toc-item-active a{
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 {
    text-decoration-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-left:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .ab-nav-left-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-right:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .ab-nav-right-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
#tally-inline-popup {
  position: fixed;
  display: none;
  z-index: 999999;
  width: min(420px, 90vw);
  height: min(550px, 80vh);
  background: #fff;
  color: #0c121d;
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.08);
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 12px 28px rgba(0,0,0,0.22), 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.12);
  overflow: hidden;
  padding: 5px;
}

#tally-inline-popup iframe {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  border: 0;
  display: block;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

#tally-inline-popup .tip-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  right: 8px;
  width: 32px;
  height: 32px;
  line-height: 28px;
  font-size: 22px;
  text-align: center;
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.85);
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
  border-radius: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
}

#main-column a[data-form-url],
#main-column a[data-tally-url] {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
  text-decoration: underline;
  text-underline-offset: 2px;
  text-decoration-thickness: 1.5px;
  font-weight: 600;
}

@media (max-width: 640px) {
  #tally-inline-popup {
    width: min(360px, 94vw);
    height: min(500px, 80vh);
  }
}

#main-column .ab-cta-button a.ab-cta-button {
  background-color: #7302D5;
}

/* Titles in purple */
.ab-link-blocks-wrapper .ab-link-block-item.ab-docs-card-mode .ab-link-block-content-wrap .font-bold {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
}

.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
}

</style>

reusableContentVariables.name: string
reusableContentVariables.description: a list or sequence of characters (like letters, numbers, and symbols) used to represent text in a computer programming.

reusableContentVariables.name: Operations
reusableContentVariables.description: An operation is a single module run to process data or check for new data.

reusableContentVariables.name: Credits
reusableContentVariables.description: Credits (formerly operations) are the currency for running scenarios.

reusableContentVariables.name: Route
reusableContentVariables.description: A route is a path that data can flow through in a scenario, visualized as the dotted lines between modules.
